title: Divide
text: Divide both sides by cosx: $$\frac{1}{\operatorname{cosx}\left(cosx-cos^3\left(x\right)\right)}=1-cos^2\left(x\right)$$ and $$\frac{1}{\operatorname{cosx}\left({\operatorname{cosxsin}\left(x\right)}^2\right)}=sin^2\left(x\right)$$

title: Verify
text: By the Pythagorean Identity, we know $$cosx-cos^3\left(x\right)={\operatorname{cosxsin}\left(x\right)}^2$$ is true.
